update: Android Beta Signup & Small QoL Changes
change: The Global Best Times for Floors 1 and 4 of the Hallowed Sepulchre have been reset, as they were only accomplished via bug abuse. The bug in question has been fixed.
Inventory space checks are now performed correctly for coffin loot in the Hallowed Sepulchre, so that items only overflow onto the ground if they need to.

poll: Old School Content Poll 72: Costume Rooms & Skilling
change:
*One of the loot rolls from the Grand Hallowed Coffin has been moved onto another coffin on the fifth level.
*The Mysterious Stranger now stores the player's hallowed tools, similar to Tool Leprechauns.
*The hallowed sack has been added to the Mysterious Hallowed Goods shop.
*The price of the dark acorn has been reduced from 5,000 Hallowed marks to 3,000. Players who have purchased one prior to this update will be refunded 2,000 Hallowed marks upon login.
Players will now cast the lowest level enchantment spell they currently have runes for when the hallowed focus is equipped, since players will always succeed in conjuring portals with it equipped.

*The instance limit for all floors has been increased from 10 to 15 players.
*The animation for fixing bridges will now show the same hammer the player is using.
*The north path fire trap on Floor 4 will now have a slightly different pattern for its first two rotations in order to make it easier to figure out the current position in the cycle.
*The Agility XP gained from treasure encounters on Floor 5 has been reduced from 100 to 80.

*The experience was rebalanced to offer less for not looting the coffins and offer more for looting. The Thieving experience for looting coffins was also increased.
*The Hallowed Focus now offers a 100% success rate in conjuring portal frames and speeds up the conjuration process.
*The strange old lockpick now also speeds up looting the coffins.
*The XP rates for each floor of the Hallowed Sepulchre have been adjusted: Floor 1: 500 (unchanged), Floor 2: 850 (unchanged), Floor 3: 1425 (down from 1500), Floor 4: 2625 (down from 2700), Floor 5: 5850 (down from 6000)
*Completing a treasure encounter on a floor will now award the following amounts of XP: Floor 1: 100 (unchanged), Floor 2: 100 (unchanged), Floor 3: 150 (up from 100), Floor 4: 150 (up from 100), Floor 5: 200 (up from 100)

*The hallowed grapple and hammer now offer a 100% success rate on pillars and bridges respectively. The bridges are also traversed faster.
*Navigating through the prayer barrier whilst wearing a hallowed symbol has been sped up slightly and the Prayer experience for sacrificing vampyre dust has been increased from 60 to 200.
*The Magic experience for conjuring portal frames has been increased from 20 to 200 and the portals attempt to put the player in range when clicked from a distance.
*All treasure encounters will now award a small amount of Agility experience when completed. This will happen twice per encounter.
*Stationary sword traps will no longer hit from further away than they should and the fire trap animations will now appear at the same time players take damage from them. The fire trap on the north path of floor 4 has also been reverted back to its original rotation on release, and the south path on floor 4 will now load the entire section to prevent a loading screen while avoiding bolts.
*Players can no longer use barbarian training methods to light fires in the Hallowed Sepulchre.
*If a ghost spawns when looting the grand coffin it will now always be the Archpriest of the Unicorn instead of the knights.

*The bolt projectile is now larger and glows, and the glow on the ground cast by the bolt is no longer bolt shaped. The tier 3 bolt projectiles now have the same hitbox as tier 1 and 2 and all bolt traps are now more forgiving when trying to move two tiles perpendicular to them.
*Sword traps will stop appearing where they should not be and the timing of a sword trap on floor 3 is now a bit more forgiving.
*The statue animations for the fire traps should now be in-sync and the fire traps on floors 1 and 2 will turn on and off at the same rate as the fire traps on floors 3 and 4.
*Players can no longer make their way (e.g. by building a bridge) to a coffin when the time has run out as it could not be looted regardless. The timer will also disappear when time runs out.
*Ghosts will now spawn after the loot is collected to not interrupt the action. They will also stop stealing the player's loot when their dialogue is interrupted.
*Players will now receive slightly more hallowed marks on floors 1–3 and slightly fewer on floors 4 and 5 (including the Grand Coffin), and players can now loot multiple coffins on floors 3 and 4. The rarity of the strange old lockpick has been adjusted to account for the multiple chests available on each floor.
*Players can now enter the barrier leading to the Grand Coffin while stood on either side of it and instances where players would be stuck when descending to a new floor have been resolved.
*The price of hallowed tokens has been decreased from 15 hallowed marks to 10 and hallowed items can no longer be alchemised.
*The amount of experience gained after completing a floor has been decreased.
*On floor 2, some blue teleport pads have been added to the north, east and west paths, and the last fire trap on the east path now has a more reasonable respawn coordinate if players fail at the end of it.
*On floor 3, the first sword traps on the west and east path now wait five cycles between catching and throwing the sword so that they are slightly more forgiving, and the firing rate of the bolts on the final trap has been slowed down by one tick.
*On floor 4, a missing pad has been added to the sword trap at the end of the north path to indicate where the sword stops, the sword and fire trap combination on the south path now has two possible solutions to reduce the amount of wait time, the last two flames of the fire trap on the northern path are now active on every rotation, and the final bolt and teleport pad combination on the south path now has some blue teleport pads.
*On floor 5, the bolt statues for the final trap have been moved forward slightly so their animations can be seen more easily, and the first bolt and teleport pad combination trap now has a few more blue teleport tiles.

*Experience gained for completing a floor is no longer scaled down depending on the time remaining.
*All treasure encounters are now enabled.
*Leaving the Hallowed Sepulchre using an obelisk will now restore run energy if players are wearing Saradomin items.
*The Grand Hallowed Coffin now awards 8–12 Hallowed marks instead of 4–7 and provides two rolls on the high-tier coffin loot table.

*Fixed a bug where players could not properly enter Hallowed Sepulchre instances.
*Fixed a bug that caused players to teleport to the entrance when completing floors. Personal best times have been reset due to this fix.
*Crystal saws can now be used to build the bridge.
When the hallowed focus is equipped, players will now cast the lowest level enchantment spell they currently have runes for, since players will always succeed in conjuring portals with it equipped.

The examine text on the hallowed focus has been changed to reflect its buff from the previous week's update. Previously, the examine text was "Reduces the chance of failing to enchant portals within the Hallowed Sepulchre."
The Hallowed focus will now slightly speed up conjuring a portal and guarantees doing so regardless of the player's Magic level and the type of enchantment spell used.
Hallowed focus can no longer be alchemised.

The examine text on the hallowed grapple has been changed to reflect its buff from the previous week's update. Previously, the examine text was "Reduces the chance of failing a grapple shortcut within the Hallowed Sepulchre."
The Hallowed grapple now has a 100% chance to grapple successfully.
All Hallowed items can no longer be alchemised.

*The hallowed hammer is now labeled as a member's item.
*The examine text on the hallowed hammer has been slightly changed; previously, the examine text was "Removes the chance of bending nails in the Hallowed Sepulchre."

v 0.25.4
* Resolved an issue that forced some users to have to log in twice.

v 0.25.2
* Resolved an issue that prevented the last used character being remembered for some users.
* Resolved an issue where macOS users may have been unable to download Old School RuneScape.
* Ensured that the log in window is always displayed after an account is logged out externally (eg, when account settings are changed).

v 0.25.0
* Preparations for Jagex accounts, ahead of their introduction in early 2023.

v 0.24.0
* Improved messaging when adding additional accounts to launcher.
* Resolved an issue that prevented launcher updates on macOS Ventura. If you still have this issue, see this support article for a permanent fix.
* Various security improvements.

v 0.23.1
* Multiple account support:
** Additional RuneScape accounts can be added by pressing the Manage Accounts button.
** A maximum of 10 accounts can be added to the launcher.
** Accounts can be selected using the menu near the Play button and used to play RuneScape or Old School.
** The launcher will remember which account was last used and pre-select it from the list.
* Resolved an issue that caused game installations to fail if free disk space could not be calculated.

v 0.22.0
* The launcher's embedded web technology has been updated to a new major version, bringing significant security and performance improvements.
* Resolved an issue that caused some users to become stuck in a CAPTCHA loop.
* Made available in an open beta for.
* Links to the account settings and rules of RuneScape removed from the Settings interface.

v 0.21.0
* The account logged in to the launcher is now listed in the settings menu.
* Refined wording used throughout the launcher in preparation for supporting multiple accounts.
* Resolved an issue that could cause the launcher icon to be displayed at an incorrect size.
* Resolved an issue that prevented games being launched immediately after installation.

v 0.19.0
* Preparation for multiple accounts:
** Refined login experience.
** Behind-the-scenes changes in preparation for supporting multiple accounts.
* Resolved an issue that caused some game launch attempts to fail.
* Resolved an issue that forced some users to have to log in twice.
* Link to the support page added to the Settings interface.

v 0.18.0
* Interface improvements:
** Refreshed the settings interface in preparation for supporting multiple accounts.
** Streamlined the top-level menu.
* Resolved multiple issues to facilitate upcoming macOS support.

v 0.17.2
* Resolved an issue that caused the launcher to forget last played game, client, or other settings.

v 0.17.1
* Increased the scope of RuneLite detection to include installations prior to August 2019.
* Various stability improvements.
* New user interfaces for launching the clients.

v 0.16.1
* RuneLite Integration:
** Added the ability to choose which game client is used to play Old School RuneScape. You can now choose between the Official Java Client and RuneLite.

v 0.15.0
* Optimised Launcher self-update:
** Reduced the amount of content downloaded during a Launcher self-update by 80%. This will take effect from the next release.
* When failing to launch the game, more context will be given as to why the game cannot be launched, and provide advice on how to resolve the issue.

v 0.14.0
* Release notes:
** Added a link to the release notes in the Settings menu.

update: Jagex Launcher Open Beta - Live Now
change:
v 0.13.0 - Open Beta Launch
* Made available in an open beta for with the following features:
** Automatic game login:
*** Stores account credentials and enables logging in to RuneScape and Old  School RuneScape without re-entering them.
** Game detection and installation:
*** Detects existing installations for both games, and enables installing them if they are not found.
** Links and latest news:
*** Shows various internet links: shop pages for both games, main websites for both games, latest four news articles for both games, list of news articles for both games, feedback form for the launcher, Account settings, Terms and Conditions, Privacy Policy, EULA, Cookies Policy, and Rules of RuneScape.
** Run on startup:
*** Enables toggling of running the launcher automatically upon starting up the operating system.
** Multi-language support:
*** Enables selecting the launcher's language between English, German, French, and Portuguese.

update: Pride 2022, Pet Reclaim Changes & New Mobile Client!
change: Ironmen fighting the Kalphite Queen will no longer find her lair devoid of Potato Cacti.

Ironmen now have their own separate Kalphite Queen instance. Two braziers have been added in the Kalphite Lair. One is located near the shortcut, and the other is at a safe spot away from the high-level Kalphite by the entrance. If they are lit it shows there is someone in the Ironman instance.

Implemented more rigorous tracking to detect alternate accounts aiding Iron players by luring the Kalphite Queen. Additionally, if combat against her halts for more than five minutes, she'll reset her health completely so that her next opponent has a fresh boss to fight.
Permanent ropes at the entrance to and inside the Kalphite Lair now require the completion of the Desert Hard diary instead of Elite.

An extremely rare drop of 2,500 Saradomin brews was removed from Konar's drop table shortly after release.

* The set bonus for the Calamity armour when wearing Koriff's coif has been changed. Previously, the player's ranged accuracy and damage were increased by 12.5%, and incoming magic damage was reduced by 10%.
* The ranged defence bonus was decreased from +24 to +12.

* The set bonus for the Calamity armour when wearing Koriff's cowl has been changed. Previously, the player's ranged accuracy and damage were increased by 10%, and incoming magic damage was reduced by 7.5%.
* The ranged defence bonus was decreased from +6 to +3.

update: Dragon Slayer II reqs, QoL and a look at the coming weeks!
change: The examine text was changed. Previously, it was "A tablet containing a magic spell."

poll: Old School Content Poll 41: Bank placeholders & Skillcapes
change: The teleport tablet was given another graphical update.
The teleport tablet was given a graphical update.
A bug was fixed where the Occult Necklace was not being dropped upon death for the Max/Med and Zerker modes in Last Man Standing.
The Volatile nightmare staff was moved to the basic tier of reward chest and the Lightbearer and Voidwaker were added to the superior tier.
Binding spell effects are now wiped more reliably at the end of a Last Man Standing session.

* Protection prayers will once again reduce damage to 60% rather than 30% of the original value.
* The tome of fire is now accessible so that players can access the buff for the Standard Spellbook.
* The stats of the black dragonhide body in Last Man Standing now match its stats in the main game.
* The bow of Faerdhinen has been removed from loot crates and chests.
* Pures are now unable to use Lunar Spells, as players with level 1 Defence cannot normally access them.
* Restricted the use of Prayers that require a Defence level higher than the account build should permit.
* Rune gloves have been changed to mithril ones for Pure builds.
* Visible Special Attack bars have been added to the zaryte crossbow, dragon knives, and light ballista.

* 2 new account build have been added to the minigame: Zerker and 1 Def pure.
* The warmup countdown duration at the beginning of the game has been increased from 7 to 12 seconds.
* Yellow notifications on the heads-up display should no longer overlap with the buff bar on official clients.
* The buff bar will also no longer show the minigame's ammo after players have left the battle arena.
* Drop item warnings and valuable loot notifications are now suppressed inside the minigame.
* As an experiment, protection prayers are now more effective. Damage is now reduced to 30%, up from 60%.
* The starting positions for players in the Wild Varrock map has been updated. The map now uses pairs of spawn points rather than clumps of six, making it more like the spawns on the Desert Island map.
* Loot crates are now more likely to spawn closer to the final safe zone in the Wild Varrock map.
* Loot chests and crates will now check what items you already have when deciding what to give you.

update: Pride 2022, Pet Reclaim Changes & New Mobile Client!
change: The Minimap's HP orb now shows players' health as a proportion of 99, as that is the base HP level used in the minigame.
Players with a total level of at least 1,500 may now participate in Competitive and High Stakes modes, even if they lack 30 Quest points.
To combat botting, participating in Competitive and High Stakes modes now requires players to have at least a total level of 750 and 30 Quest points.
A bug where poison effects were cleared upon passing the barrier for entering the minigame have been fixed.
The fake XP drops in Last Man Standing now show normal XP quantities for Group Iron players, even though Group Iron players usually get reduced XP for PvP.
Last Man Standing now grants kill credit more reliably for players standing on the outskirts of the Dark Varrock map.
Purchasing rewards from the Last Man Standing store now requires 48 hours of playtime as a member.

update: Games Room Tables and Fishing Skill Boss Improvements
change:
*In Last Man Standing, ancient spells are no longer greyed out for players who have not completed Desert Treasure I.
*The spawn locations for the Wild Varrock Last Man Standing map have been spread out.

*Added a second map to the map pool, Wild Varrock.
*Free-to-play worlds will no longer have the option to play Competitive LMS.
*The default Last Man Standing map has been renamed "Deserted Island".
*Numerous textual fixes for Deserted Island.
*Added a new loot crate model and animation.
*Loot chests will no longer visually open unless you have a key, but their functionality remains the same.
*Added a three-strikes system to reduce abusive behaviour.

update: God Wars Instancing and Soul Wars Improvements
change: Players with no display name are now barred from Last Man Standing until they set one.

update: Volcanic Mine and Ava's Devices Changes
change: The win counter now goes up to 32,767.
The 'damaged by fog' hitsplats in Last Man Standing now show the correct healthbar.

*If a player logs out mid-combat, their opponent will be awarded the kill and all related benefits
*Players must now kill at least one player before being awarded any points.
*Each point will now be worth an average of 15,000 to 20,000 GP when exchanged for items in Justine's shop.
*A typo has been fixed in Last Man Standing.
The minigame has been moved from the Giants' Plateau to Ferox Enclave.
You will no longer be stuck with the wrong spellbook if you leave the Last Man Standing waiting enclosure before the battle starts.

*Competitive Mode entry fee has been removed.
*Players who show no signs of valid progression during a game will become attackable by other players while in combat with another player.
*Bloody and bloodier keys now have a chance to give mithril seeds.

update: Nightmare Feedback and the Zalcano Loot Table
change:
*Competitive Mode entry fee has been changed back to 10,000 coins.
*High Stakes entry fee has been increased from 100,000 coins to 500,000 coins.
*Ironman accounts can no longer participate in High Stakes.

update: Poll 69, BH Rewards, and Welcome Screen
change: High Stakes entry fee has been increased from 50,000 to 100,000 coins.
Wild dogs no longer spawn in the minigame.

poll: Last Man Standing: More Rewards
change: The Wilderness crabs teleport has been added to the rewards shop.

*Crates of loot now spawn in LMS on F2P worlds as they do on members' worlds.
*The US Last Man Standing world has been moved from world 492 to 469 so that non-members can use it.

update: PvP Balancing, LMS, and Elf Graphics
change:
*The smoke puff animation now has a matching sound when loot crates are opened.
*The messages at the end of a game have been reordered.
*The LMS reward shop menu's click-zones have been expanded to include the pictures as well as the text.
*The description on the LMS coffer has been corrected.
*NPCs in LMS can now be targeted by members-only Ancient spells on F2P.
*Players may no longer go up vertical ladders in LMS if they have recently been in combat; this restriction previously applied at some points during a game, but now applies throughout it. The restriction does not stop players climbing down the LMS ladders and does not apply to the diagonal ladders of watchtowers either, since the upper level of those is visible from the ground.
*XP drops no longer overlap with the HUD.
*The number of LMS-enabled worlds has been adjusted.
Free-to-play competitive games now require a total level of 150 to participate, unless the player is a member.
Boosted stats can no longer be taken outside of the minigame.

poll: Last Man Standing Rewards Poll Blog
change:
*Players are now given a default preset of items that are provided upon arriving rather than just a spear.
*Defence levels for the duration of the game have been increased from 70 to 75.
*Prayer points are now unlimited instead of being drained to 10 at the start.
*Run energy is now unlimited.
*A map of the island has been added to the world map.
*Players' stats, run energy, special attack energy and supplies are now all replenished upon killing an opponent.
*Vending shrines and the items obtained from it have been removed.
*The loot table has been split into offensive and defensive tables, with bloodier keys giving an upgraded loot table containing Ancient Warriors' weapons.
*Points are now awarded for competitive games, used as the currency for the reward shop.
Lisa now waits 60 seconds instead of 30 before a game begins in order for other players to join in more easily.

poll: State of PvP Poll
change:
*Casual games of Last Man Standing now begin after 30 seconds of a minimum number of 4 players being in the lobby, making games between friends easier to start. If the lobby reaches 24 players, the game begins immediately.
*Competitive and high stakes games of Last Man Standing now begin with 24 players, reduced from 48.
The music track can now be unlocked by entering the lobby of Last Man Standing rather than during a game.

update: Theatre of Blood: Entry Mode Improvements
change: Players can no longer receive a loot key if they are in a trade screen. The key will now be dropped where the player died.

update: Unranked Group Iron Changes and More!
change: Loot Keys can now be destroyed within the Wilderness if they contain less than 30,000 coins worth of loot. There is a small delay to this process to discourage players from destroying loot during combat.
Loot keys' despawn timer has been extended to two minutes, for consistency with other drops.

* The cost of unlocking the loot key was decreased from 5,000,000 coins to 1,000,000 coins. Players who have already unlocked the loot keys with the original price were reimbursed 4,000,000 coins deposited into their banks.
* Loot Chests were added to the Grand Exchange, Edgeville bank and Mage Arena bank.
* When players kill each other in a duel, one of the players no longer receives the entire loot. Instead, when a player is killed by an opponent that is either in the process of dying or has died recently, their loot keys will be destroyed and their loot will drop to the floor regardless of the loot key settings of the other player.
The Revenant Caves fee is now included in the loot within the Loot Chest.
If the player's inventory is full, the loot key will drop to the floor and the player will be able to pick it up normally without it being removed.

poll: Old School Content Poll 79: Quality of Life
change: Players can now purchase looting bags from any Slayer Master for 10 slayer reward points.
Checking the looting bag's contents while moving no longer makes the game forget the player's destination.

The drop rate of looting bags from monsters with a combat level of 10 or lower has been increased from 1/30 to 1/15, while the monster combat level cap to achieve a 1/3 drop rate has been decreased from 100 to 50.

*The looting bag now accepts deposits without an initial delay within the Wilderness on PvP worlds, like it does in the Wilderness on standard worlds.
*Destroying looting bags now have the same delay as manually dropping items while in PvP combat.
The looting bag is now useable in certain locations on PvP worlds.

update: Looting Bag Improvements, PID Changes and Bounty Hunter Targets
change:
*The looting bag now has an "Open" option which allows items that players pick up to be deposited straight into the bag, while using the "Close" option does the opposite.
*The "Check" option was made right-click.
*The cost of a looting bag in the Bounty Hunter Shop has been reduced from 150,000 points to 10,000.

Destroying a looting bag within the Wilderness now drops the items within it (except food and potions) to the ground to prevent victims from "denying" their killer from getting the items in their looting bag by destroying it. Outside the Wilderness, contents are still destroyed.

update: Kebos Graphical Changes and Other Fixes
change: Tutor icons in the newcomer map can now be toggled on and off correctly on mobile.
The item became permanently available with the launch of RuneScape 2.
The item was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.
Wearing either a gas mask, facemask, or slayer helmet will now prevent infection from Nex's choke attack, as well as from other infected players.
Nex's overheads for Soul Split and Deflect Melee have been updated to use the Ruinous Powers colour scheme.
Nex's overhead for Wrath has been updated to use the Ruinous Powers colour scheme.
The player who dealt the most damage to Nex is now broadcast at the end of the encounter.
Nex will now consistently spawn a Blood Reaver when fought with two players.
The chance of Nex rolling the unique drop table was reverted to 1/43.
Combat Achievements were added for Nex.

* An issue with players being able to unintentionally receive two unique drops from Nex has been fixed.
* An issue preventing players from receiving any unique drops has been fixed.
Players can now cast Monster Examine on Nex.

* Nex has received some changes in the final phase of the fight:
** Soul Split healing has been combined into one hitsplat during her final phase.
** Melee attacks are now used more frequently, providing that Nex's target is within melee distance.
** Behaviour in regards to changing targets has been made more predictable.
* Nex's loot table has been re-adjusted. Mainly, the chance of Nex rolling the unique drop table was decreased from 1/43 to 1/53.
* Nex can now be selected when setting up activities for clan events.
* An issue has been fixed in which players did not receive loot when joining instances at the same moment the fight began.
Nex will now flip to another part of the chamber if she doesn't attack for a period of time, even if she's in the centre of the chamber.
Players who have completed the hard Combat Achievements can now have friends join their private instance when fighting Nex.

* A warning has been added to the safe room before the main area of the prison to inform players that they have items that have not yet been reclaimed after death.
* Supply drop quantities have been decreased in encounters with higher amounts of players.
* The maximum number of players allowed in an encounter has been reduced from 80 to 60.
* Nex's standard attacks will now hit more players.
* The order of special attacks performed by Nex in each phase are now randomised.
* Nex will now activate Soul Split upon beginning the final phase of the fight.

* An issue with Nex being immune to damage after certain phases has been fixed.
* All items awarded to a player from Nex (aside from her bones) will now drop at the players' feet.
* Wearing either a gas mask, facemask, or slayer helmet will now reduce duration of the cough effect as part of her smoke mechanic slightly.

poll: Old School feature poll 10: New Rewards
change:
*The Seer, Archer, Warrior and Berserker rings can be imbued, improving their combat stats.
*Crystal bows and shields can be imbued, making them keep their combat stats unchanged as they degrade.
*Black Masks can be imbued, giving you combat bonuses when using Magic or Ranged attacks against your assigned Slayer target, and improving their combat stats a little.
*The reward shop now sells Scrolls of Redirection that can be used to change the destination of a 'Teleport to House' tablet. You can choose a destination of any player-owned house portal, or Trollheim.
*The reward shop now sells vials and a limited supply of herb boxes.
Some balancing changes have been made in Nightmare Zone to favour players who've completed a wider variety of quests, not just the Lunar series.

* The Dagannoth and Gelattinoth Mothers no longer notify you about their colour changes if you've left the Nightmare Zone arena.
* Nightmare Zone now plays more appropriate music for the Ice Troll King.

change:

change: A typo when handing dragonstones over to Olbertus was fixed.

update: Theatre of Blood: Entry Mode Improvements

* Fixed animation issues with various NPCs
* Fixed bugs with the XP Tracker displaying incorrect information
* Stabilized the build following reports of crashes
Fixed an issue causing the chatbox to enter an unusable state.

*A final fix has been released for the black screen issues some players have been experiencing.
*Support for OpenGL ES 2.0 has been deprecated, meaning devices that don't support OpenGL ES 3+ will no longer work with the mobile client.

update: Diversity & Inclusion Changes and Quest Speedrunning Updates
change: Optimised the on-tap highlights to help with framerate dropping issues.
iOS users can now make use of the Bond voucher codes

* Resolved an issue with text displayed on the Helper menu.
* Resolved an issue where Bank Pin numbers were disappearing.
* Resolved issues for players experiencing a 'black screen'.
* Tool-tips are now aligned to the left-hand side following player feedback.

update: Tombs of Amascut: Ornament Kits & More!
change: Skills tab tooltips no longer disappear after gaining XP.

update: New Client Update: Clue Scroll Helper
change:
* Improvements have been made when opening or closing Side Panels.
* Fixed an issue with entity overlays inside the Chambers of Xeric.
* Resolved various issues that caused the app to crash or become unresponsive.
* Fixed an issue allowing Prayer to activate after clicking on an Inventory item and changing tab via hotkey.
* Audio now works correctly with certain slider setups.
* Fixed an issue where tiles highlighted incorrectly under certain circumstances.
* Reduced the visibility of grid lines.

update: Unranked Group Iron Changes and More!
change: The will now work for players using the latest iOS client.

update: Pride 2022, Pet Reclaim Changes & New Mobile Client!
change:
Fully released the new client features on both Android and iOS devices:
* Buff Bars
* Fishing Spot Indicators
* HUD Improvements (NPC Information and Combat Styles)
* Agility and Slayer Helpers
* Chambers of Xeric Helper
* Woodcutting and Ore Respawn Timers
* Increased Draw Distance
* Navigation Tile Indicators
* Chat Improvements
* Entity Highlights for NPCs
Device requirements for running the client have been raised:
* At least iOS 13.0 instead of iOS 10.0
* At least Android 8.0 and 2 GB RAM instead of only Android 5.0

* The Multiway Combat icon no longer overlaps with the collapsed Minimap.
* Entity Highlights now work correctly in the Tears of Guthix minigame.
* The player can no longer interact with the Minimap through the XP tracker.
* Cleared private chat history will now remain cleared when logging back in.
* Fairy Rings are now highlighted by Entity Highlights.
* Fixed Entity Highlights for player-grown Mahogany Trees.
* The HP Regen indicator now correctly updates when running out of Prayer Points with Rapid Heal on.
* Long Tap Delay settings now update visually after setting the new value.
* Unused interfaces are no longer visible while on Target Worlds.
An Account Deletion button has been added in the Account Management tab, under the Useful Links section.
Fixed an issue where the word 'null' was appearing in shop menus for mobile users.
The Bond store is now available once more on iOS devices.

update: Game Improvements and Email Linking for Mobile Accounts
change:
The following changes have been made:
*Accounts created through mobile can once again be linked to an email address.
*Tapping a player's username in the chatbox now opens the keyboard instead of the text line.

update: Nightmare Feedback and the Zalcano Loot Table
change:
The following changes have been made:
*Mobile devices which don't use the slider which controls how far apart the interfaces are will no longer have that slider.
*Wiki link has been re-enabled for iOS users.

update: Nightmare Feedback and the Zalcano Loot Table
change: Players may no longer redeem bonds for membership on iOS devices if they already have an active membership.

update: Game Improvements and Nightmare Beta Changes
change:
The following changes have been made:
*The tap-to-drop option for mobile users will be toggled off if the player logs out for more than a few minutes, so that players are less likely to drop their stuff by mistake when they return.
*Links to Old School websites in the Account Management tabs and on the welcome screen are no longer displayed when playing on iOS devices

A new slider on the options side-panel now adjusts the minimum dead-zone at the side of your screen. Shifting the side-stones will shift in real time. This setting will be remembered after logout and persist for each account that logs into the same device.

update: Last Man Standing Beta and Splashing Restrictions
change:
The following changes have been made:
*Fixed PvP world login warning.
*Added clearer disconnect reason messaging.

The following changes have been made:
*Free players tapping on a members skill on the stats interface should no longer randomly stop you performing skilling actions.
*The mobile app's icon that shows the app to be using mobile data rather than wifi has been changed. The previous picture of a smartphone ([[File:Mobile data usage v1.png]]) was unclear, whereas the new icon is a more standard design and is consistent with the wifi indicator.

update: Boxing Mechanics and Lots of Fixes
change:
The following changes have been made:
*The Pest Control shop interface has had its black background removed, since it wasn't rendering well on Mobile devices. As part of this, the buttons have been made more responsive.
*The world switcher layout has been restructured to make sort buttons stay visible as the interface scrolls and increased size of the sorting buttons on mobile.
*The Pyramid Plunder overlay is now positioned in the top left making it less obstructive.
*The Wintertodt Boss next game countdown timer no longer displays when a game has started, this occurred when backgrounding the app on iOS and returning as the next round starts.
*The Prayer tab now has an info button which when activated displays tooltip information on tap.
*The Store orb no longer overlaps the Castle Wars timer.

update: Kebos Graphical Changes and Other Fixes
change:
The following changes have been made:
*The chatbox interface no longer obstructs cutscenes during Making History and Swan Song.
*Deleting text on the Report Abuse interface after closing the keyboard now works as expected.
*The area left of the XP counter now registers taps when the counter is disabled.
*Tutor icons in the newcomer map can now be toggled on and off correctly on mobile.
*A flash effect in a cutscene from Another Slice of H.A.M. has been fixed.

update: Bird Nest Balancing and PvP Changes

*The 'if' in "Well if I find out anything useful, I'll come let you know, alright?" player line was lowercased.

* Level 40 combat is now required to board the lander and play the game.

change: One-off pets are now automatically insured by Probita upon receiving one. Players who've paid the insurance fee of 500,000 coins prior to this update will have the fees paid added to Probita's reclaim fee coffer, which can then be used as a discount towards any further reclaims. For example, if players insured two pets for 500,000 coins each, they will be given one free reclaim token, and if five were insured, they will be given two free reclaim tokens and a 500,000 coins discount towards the next reclaim token purchase.

update: Theatre of Blood: Entry Mode Improvements
change: Combat Achievements were added for the boss.
A bug was fixed where the Phantom Muspah's Freeze duration reduction was applying twice.
The quantity of various items dropped have been reduced slightly.

* The ectoplasmator now works on the Phantom Muspah.
* Monster Examine now displays the boss's defensive stats.
* The Phantom Muspah's entry in the Collection Log will now turn green when filled.
* Returned the original melee dodge mechanic the boss had on release; as a consequence, the 10% ice spell accuracy bonus was removed.

* A bug in which the boss always hits zero whilst moving towards you while attacking, and having Protect from Melee active, has been fixed.
* The boss's melee attack is now less accurate with Protect from Melee active. To compensate, the melee attack will now hit through the prayer more consistently.
* The boss's melee attacks should now be easier to dodge when keeping distance from it.
* The accuracy of ice spells are now increased by 10% when the boss is not frozen.
* The boss should now behave more consistently if taken down before the Prayer Shield phase.
* The quantity of various seeds and herbs have been reduced slightly.
* The drop rate of supplies has been reduced from 1/3.5 to 1/4.5.
Corrected a typo in Phantuwti's dialogue.
Charged sceptres now appear as they did prior to 27 April 2022 rather than having the appearance of an uncharged sceptre.

poll: Tombs of Amascut Rewards
change:
The original pharaoh's sceptre is now discontinued: 
* All variants of the pharaoh's sceptre that existed prior to 27 April 2022 have had all their interface options replaced with a "Convert" option, which replaces it with a reworked version of the sceptre.
* The teleport options are now in a separate interface akin to that of a ring of dueling, accessed by the sceptre's "Teleport" option. A "Last-Teleport" option will instantly teleport players to the previous destination.
In addition: 
* The sceptre can now be uncharged by players rather than needing to visit the guardian mummy to do so.
* The sceptre can now be charged by the guardian mummy at any time, rather than only being able to recharge it once all charges are expended.
* The maximum amount of charges the sceptre holds has been further increased based on the tier of Desert Diary completed.
** The Easy Diary now allows a maximum of 10 charges, up from 4.
** The Medium Diary now allows a maximum of 25 charges, up from 5.
** The Hard Diary now allows a maximum of 50 charges, up from 6.
** The Elite Diary now allows a maximum of 100 charges, up from 8.

update: Looting Bag Improvements, PID Changes and Bounty Hunter Targets
change: On Bounty Hunter, PvP, and tournament worlds, PID will randomise every 40 to 60 game ticks (24 to 36 seconds) per player rather than the previous 100 to 150 game ticks (60 to 90 seconds) per player.

poll: Quality of Life - Top 10 PvP Suggestions
change:
* Priority is now only randomised once every 100 - 150 game ticks (60 - 90 seconds), no longer every game tick. 
* Within the duel arena, the relative priority of players who are fighting each other will not change throughout the duration of a duel.
The game engine no longer prioritises players' actions based on the IP address from which they are logged in.

Brand-new players cannot log in to PvP worlds. These restrictions can be removed by logging over 20 hours of game time, earning 10 quest points, and reaching 100 total level. Alternatively, you can purchase membership to bypass these requirements.

update: Game Improvements and Email Linking for Mobile Accounts
change: To counter Bot accounts, Players in PvP Worlds can no longer use the Fountains in Lumbridge as water source.

The attack options for players will no longer appear when in a safe zone in PvP Worlds.

update: Pride 2022, Pet Reclaim Changes & New Mobile Client!
poll: Old School Content Poll 76: Game Improvements
change: One-off pets are now automatically insured upon receiving one. Players who've paid the insurance fee of 500,000 coins prior to this update will have the fees paid added to Probita's reclaim fee coffer, which can then be used as a discount towards any further reclaims. For example, if players insured two pets for 500,000 coins each, they will be given one free reclaim token, and if five were insured, they will be given two free reclaim tokens and a 500,000 coins discount towards the next reclaim token purchase.
Probita's menu now shows the price for reclaiming pets.

* The price for a scroll of imbuing has been reduced from 500 points to 200. Players who purchased one prior to this update will be refunded their points.
The Fossil Island Museum Camp bank chest tent is now a safe area on PvP worlds.
The PvP world rotation was turned off for world deployment system maintenance. All PvP worlds are available simultaneously.

To combat luring, the following areas are now safe on PvP worlds:
* Ape Atoll Bank area
* Barbarian Outpost
* Blast Mine Bank Chests
* Duel Arena entrance
* Fossil Island - North Island Bank
* Soul Wars Lobby
* The Kourend Castle building (all floors)
* Volcanic Mine Bank area
* Xeric's Glade - Grape Vines

Worlds are no longer changing from PvP activity worlds to regular worlds and back. Instead, the regular worlds are available full time, while the worlds that are for PvP or LMS are be turned on and off depending on the weekly rotation. The casual LMS worlds are no longer in the rotation.

To prevent some unwanted behaviour where NPCs neither retaliate nor retreat, there has been a change to how NPCs decide whether they retreat or retaliate. In particular, this affects how monsters such as Callisto and Vet'ion will behave when lured to the limits of their wander range. This change applies to all monsters with long range attacks.

A game engine bug affecting the retaliation of ranging/maging NPCs has been fixed. In particular, this affects Venenatis and Vet'ion and their behaviour when they have moved far from their spawn points, so it will make certain safespots considerably less effective, and will have similar effects on other NPCs with long-range attacks.

To prevent some unwanted behaviour where NPCs neither retaliate nor retreat, there has been a change to how NPCs decide whether they retreat or retaliate. In particular, this affects how monsters such as Callisto and Vet'ion will behave when lured to the limits of their wander range. This change applies to all monsters with long range attacks.

update: Pride 2022, Pet Reclaim Changes & New Mobile Client!
change: The entrance and exits of the Revenant Caves are now even further apart.
The entrances are now one-way into the caves; to make up for this, players can leave the dungeon by using a one-way exit near these entrances.
The entrance at level 26 Wilderness has been made one-way; players will be warned when attempting to enter from here.

*Revenant Caves overhauled - non-revenant monsters moved to the Wilderness Slayer Cave.
*Increased amount of Revenants in the cave, and spread them over the entirety of the cave
*Third entrance added at level 26 Wilderness.
*100,000 coin entry fee required to access dungeon.
*Combat zones modified to "singles-plus" - players can still fight revenants, but they can be attacked by another player while fighting them.
*Being skulled has less impact on drop rates
*A dwarf multicannon can no longer be set up anywhere within the caves
*Numerous uninteractable ghosts added across the caves

*Bracelet of Ethereum damage reduction lowered by 25% for a total of 75% damage reduction.
*The average value of the revenant drop table been reduced by around 20%.

update: The Collection Log and Deadman Permadeath Beta
change: Players are now prevented from spamming the entrance/exit to the Revenant caves to avoid PKers.

*The magic attack of the Revenants will now target several players at once. Up to 10 players stood on the same tile as the main target will be targeted with the magic attack. 
*The chances of rolling on the normal loot table have been increased slightly.

*Reduced overall value of revenant drops
*Dwarf multicannons can no longer be placed within the Revenant area of the caves

*Increased the likelihood of landing on the normal loot table instead of coins.
*Removed some lesser valuable drops and increased quantities of regular loot.
*Tweaked various weightings across the normal loot table and all 100x drops have been removed.
*Added Ancient Statuettes to the drop table.

change:

change: High level rogues have been added to the Rogues' Castle.

The Rogue's revenge now has a chathead.

update: Games Room Tables and Fishing Skill Boss Improvements
change: The maximum quantities of fish you can select for processing in Camdozaal have been corrected.
The poly limit has been increased.
Resolved an engine issue causing players to turn invisible.
A number of fixes have been made to the engine that should resolve a majority of the issues introduced with the update last week.
Implemented a new engine feature to be used in future updates; made some tweaks to help resolve some uncommon technical issues.

*The combat stance system has been overhauled to make players less likely to get put in a Defensive stance unexpectedly when switching weapons or autocasting spells.
*The game engine team has been making adjustments following last week's rewrite of mouse-clicking. So far they've fixed the bug it introduced whereby the left-click 'Deposit' option on bank deposit boxes didn't work.
The game's click-interpretation system has been rewritten to try and improve its behaviour when clicking multiple items rapidly.

poll: Old School feature poll 2 – April 2013
change: Routefinding calculations are now performed on the server, not the client. This especially improves the navigation for players trying to use melee against large monsters, as well as resolving numerous other navigation-related race conditions.
The game client is now more responsive for players trying to equip lots of items quickly.

change: The helmet's envenoming capabilities was improved, giving poisoned weapons a 50% chance to envenom and venom-inflicting weapons a 100% chance when the helmet is worn.

The envenoming effect, which gave opponents a 1 in 6 chance (16.7%) of being envenomed if they attacked the player wearing the helmet, was removed. The strength bonus of the helmet was also reduced from +5 to +3.

poll: Quality of Life - Ten Skilling Suggestions

poll: Deadman and Ditch
change: The attack action options have been separated into two settings for players and NPCs. An additional option for hiding the attack option has also been added for both players and NPCs.

*A visual glitch where the slider moved when teleporting is now fixed.
*The camera height now moves up slightly as you zoom in to keep the character in the correct position on the screen.
*It is now much easier to aim the toad cannon and hit the sheep in Mourning's End Pt. 1 in resizable mode.

*Separated out some interface and graphics options into an 'advanced options' menu.
* Added two toggles for click through chat box and whether hotkeys can be used to close side-panels when using resizable mode.

poll: Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll
change:
The following have been added to the game: 
*A shortcut between Burthorpe and the Chaos Temple that you can use at level 14 agility if you have completed the Falador Easy Diary.
*A shortcut between Draynor Village and Port Sarim that you can use at level 43 agility if you have completed the Medium Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.
*A shortcut between the entrance and the Fire giants that you can use at level 46 agility if you have completed the Wilderness Medium Diary.
*A shortcut in the Motherlode Mine that you can use at level 54 agility if you have completed the Falador Medium Diary.
*A shortcut between the Miscellania docks and Etceteria that you can use at level 55 agility if you have completed the Fremennik Medium Diary.
*A shortcut across the estuary on Mos Le'Harmless that you can use at level 60 agility if you have completed the Morytania Hard Diary.
*A shortcut between Lumbridge Swamp and the Kharidian Desert that you can use at level 66 agility if you have completed the Hard Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.
*A shortcut in the basement of the Heroes' Guild to the Fountain of Heroes that you can use at level 67 agility if you have completed the Falador Hard Diary.
*A shortcut from the entrance to the roof of the Troll Stronghold that you can use at level 73 agility if you have completed the Fremennik Hard Diary.
*A shortcut on the south side to Lava Dragon Isle that you can use at level 74 agility if you have completed the Wilderness Hard Diary.
*A shortcut across the Shilo Village river that you can use at level 77 agility if you have completed the Karamja Elite Diary.
*A shortcut in the Brimhaven Dungeon leading to the red dragons that you can use at level 83 agility if you have completed the Karamja Elite Diary.
*A shortcut in the Kalphite Lair that you can use at level 86 agility if you have completed the Desert Elite Diary.

** Bloodveld, Aberrant spectre, Aviansies, Mithril Dragons, Cave Horror, Dust Devil, Skeletal Wyvern, Gargoyle, Nechryael, and Cave Kraken.

poll: A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
change: Hard mode and entry mode versions of the Theatre of Blood encounters added.

update: Theatre of Blood Changes & Deadman Summer Finals
change: The large ball of energy attack now has the same timing regardless of the player's distance from the boss and the message notifying of it is now highlighted, and the magical and ranged attacks can no longer stack on the player on the same game tick.

poll: Old School Content Poll 76: Game Improvements
change: The pre-existing delay after using Essence on Runecraft Altars has been removed.
'Soul Fall' unlock area has been slightly expanded westwards, up to the one-way shortcut to dense essence mine, replacing Arcane.
Added unlock hint for this track: 'This track unlocks north east of Arceuus.'
Added to game and set to play at the path to Soul Altar.
The Salve amulet's combat bonuses now apply to ghost within Soul Wars.
Soul Wars public games now only require two players per team to start on Fresh Start Worlds.

* Soul Wars can now be played on any world.
* A "Buy X" option has been added to the "Other" tab in the reward shop.
* Combat experience from the reward shop has been increased:
** Attack, Defence, Strength, and Hitpoints increased from 24 XP to 30 XP per zeal.
** Ranged and Magic increased from 22 XP to 27 XP per zeal.
** Prayer increased from 12 XP to 14 XP per zeal.

* Most Soul Wars-specific items no longer have a Destroy confirmation box and can now be quickly shift-dropped.
* Soul Wars Clan mode now awards more Zeal, the maximum amount of Zeal awarded per game has been increased to 30.

poll: Old School Content Poll 74: Collection Log & Game Improvements
change:
* The Soul Wars guide and tutorial have been updated to reference the new waiting rooms, as well as the changes to the cooldown to leave Graveyards and Bases after death.
* Players can now purchase blighted items from the Reward Shop for 10 Zeal each, though they can't be sold back again or be used during a game.

update: Puro-Puro Improvements and Barbarian Assault Changes
change:
* Players will now always unfreeze at the end of a game.
* Time remaining messages are now handled by the server, which should stop them from appearing twice.
* The blue waiting area has been changed into the main Soul Wars waiting area (which now has a white barrier).
* The red waiting area has been changed into a clan waiting area (which now has a purple barrier), where clan members can challenge each other to games.
* The Balance Portal has been removed.

update: God Wars Instancing and Soul Wars Improvements
change:
* The inactivity timer will begin to tick down 10 seconds after a game starts instead of immediately.
* Items in the "Other" section of the Reward Shop can now be examined.
* The tutorial will now properly display the chatheads of bearded players.
* The duration in which players cannot exit a Graveyard has been reduced from 15 seconds to 10. In addition, players will now receive immunity when exiting, which lasts for a few seconds or until another player is attacked.
* Attempting to attack Avatars from outside the boss room will now cause the minigame to pull the player in, instead of a message telling them to move closer.
* Bandage healing will now display the name of the player that healed them instead of their own name.
* Skulled players on Deadman worlds can no longer start the tutorial or enter a waiting area.
* Bones and soul fragments will now appear above other dropped items during a game.
* Gravestones will no longer appear in waiting areas.
* Players will no longer be able to bypass the temporary ban for leaving a game early by hopping to another world.
* A "Check" option has been added to spoils of war to show how many players have opened so far.
* It is no longer possible to open Spoils of War on Entrana.
* Rebalanced the quantities of certain items in the Spoils of War.

Also, after the initial launch of Soul Wars and the addition of new worlds to handle all the players wanting to try it out, we have decided that we will be continuing with 3 Soul Wars worlds, one in each global region:

* 320 US
* 350 UK
* 535 AUS

* The activity bar now takes 150 seconds to fully deplete rather than 120.
* Ultimate Ironmen can now use the looting bag during a game.
* The loot table for spoils of war have been adjusted, reducing quantities of runite ore and seeds. In addition, dragon items, rune items, seeds, and runite ore are now rarer.
* Items which transform the player (such as the ring of stone and ring of coins) can no longer be used during a game.
* A confirmation message will now appear when attempting to leave the lobby.
Solved an issue with Soul Wars games starting later than usual, due to instances not closing after a game was complete, making no instance available for a new game.
Four additional Soul Wars worlds were added: 331 (US West), 336 (Germany), 341 (UK) and 477 (US East).
Three additional Soul Wars worlds were added (in addition to the original two): 328 (Germany), 329 (US East), 535 (Australia).

* A "Buy X" option has been added to the "Other" tab in the reward shop.
* Combat experience from the reward shop has been increased:
** Attack, Defence, Strength, and Hitpoints increased from 24 XP to 30 XP per zeal.
** Ranged and Magic increased from 22 XP to 27 XP per zeal.
** Prayer increased from 12 XP to 14 XP per zeal.

update: Chambers of Xeric, Kebos, and Collection Log Changes

update: Last Man Standing Beta and Splashing Restrictions
change: Temple Spiders now drop red spiders' eggs in larger quantities.

* Hat of the eye (reduced to 400 from 500)
* Robe top of the eye (reduced to 350 from 400)
* Robe bottoms of the eye (reduced to 350 from 400)
* Boots of the eye (reduced to 250 from 300)
Players can no longer have multiple followers while Temple Trekking.
"Continue" is now the left-click option to continue your trek in Temple Trekking.

poll: Old School Content Poll 46: Wintertodt Rewards & Superior Slayer
change: Temple Trekking NPCs now have right-click escort options.

poll: Old School Content Poll 44: PvP & Player-owned houses
change: Players can now choose which reward they would like to receive from the reward token, and claim them directly from the token without having to hand it in.

Feeding purple sweets to the sickly NPC during Temple Trekking no longer consumes the entire stack.
Burgh de Rott Ramble, a reverse Temple Trekking route, is now available to players who have completed Darkness of Hallowvale.

poll: Old School Content Poll 37: Skillcape Perks
change: The examine of this key has been updated from "A key for the Temple Library." to "A key for the Temple Library (Used in the In Aid of the Myreque quest)." so its purpose is better described.

poll: Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll
change: You now have access to the locked room with the monkey skull if you have completed the Hard Western Provinces Diary.
Tempoross Fishing Spots no longer have holes in their clickbox.

You'll now receive a Big Harpoonfish (if you've previously received one) rather than 25 Soaked Pages to showcase how many you've got in the Collection Log. The Retired Sailor will still trade you pages for your fish.
Players can no longer attack the Tempoross Fishing spots.

update: Games Room Tables and Fishing Skill Boss Improvements
change: The aforementioned change to Tempoross' behaviour below 10% energy has been reverted.

update: Games Room Tables and Fishing Skill Boss Improvements
change:
* Reducing Tempoross' energy to 10% or lower will now prevent it from attacking for 15 seconds rather than indefinitely. If players don't continue to shoot fish within that time, it will begin to attack again.
* Fire hitboxes are now slightly bigger, covering more of the 2x2 space they occupy. In addition, the height of the fire will no longer change mid-animation.
* Fires now remove resources every two ticks (1.2 seconds) rather than one (0.6 seconds).
* The wave attack won't disrupt as many actions when it's incoming, such as when cooking at the shrine.

update: Arceuus Spellbook Beta and A Kingdom Divided Preparation
change:
* A new overlay has been added to the lobby and the surrounding area. This will show how many players are waiting in the lobby, and indicate how long until the ship takes players to Tempoross Cove.
* Player's Personal Bests and Time Taken stats are now displayed after successfully defeating the boss. They've also been added to the Spirit Angler stats board in the Ruins of Unkah.
* A quick-climb option has been added to the Tempoross lobby ladder, as well as a water pump aboard the ship.
* UI on both mobile and PC has been moved to create more space on the screen.

* Items that require setting up (e.g. dwarf multicannons, mithril seeds, box traps, etc) can no longer be used on the ship taking players to Tempoross Cove, nor can players light fires on it.
* Players can no longer stall to run through fires.
* Points from dousing fires and fixing totem poles have been increased from 20 to 40.
* Fishing XP may now be gained in Tempoross encounters on world 345.

update: Collection Log Improvements and The Last of Poll 74
change: The ship taking players to Tempoross Cove will now sail there after 30 seconds instead of 60.
Players without a house will no longer gain Construction experience when repairing the mast or totem pole.

* The sceptre now has a "Swap" option that switches it to an autocasting variant.
* The attack animation is now corrected when used against players.

* Thammaron's sceptre is now a powered staff.
* The magic attack bonus has been reduced from +20 to +15.
* The passive effect that increases the magic accuracy has been decreased from 100% to 50%, while the magic damage bonus has been increased from 25% to 50%.

poll: Future Quests & Combat Achievement Rewards
change:
The following skill experience rewards have increased:
*Slayer from 15,000 to 50,000
*Crafting from 15,000 to 50,000.
*Runecraft from 5,000 to 30,000.
The music track is now listed in the Music Player.
After Koschei the Deathless drained your prayer in Fremennik Trials, players could simply restore it and re-activate their prayers. Koschei now keeps it drained.
A minor animation bug in the Fremennik Trials quest when playing the lyre has been resolved.

update: Old School RuneScape: Early Access Now Open
change: This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

* Players are now prompted whether they want to attempt another translation after inputting a correct one.
* Inputting a translation for a word the player hasn't discovered yet in-game now results in a different message.
* Reading the stone tablet is now clearer; blue translated words now indicate words in incorrect context, whilst new, green translated words indicate the word is correct in context.
* Players can no longer teleport within the dungeons; attempting to do so results in the game message "An ancient magical force blocks your teleport."
* The dragonkin symbols have been removed from the stone chests in the dungeons.
* The dirty notes, wood carvings, and compass now have a "Drop" option instead of "Destroy".
The music track is now listed in the Music Player.
Filling vials in The Gauntlet no longer interrupts fishing.
Entering and leaving The Gauntlet with an amulet of avarice equipped will no longer clear the player's skull.
The minimum HiScores 'killcount' required for The Corrupted Gauntlet has been lowered from 10 to 5.

poll: A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
change:
* Players can now make escape crystals to teleport out of the Gauntlet instantly to avoid loss of hardcore ironman status.
* Players can now make crystal paddlefish, which heals 16 Hitpoints and act as cooked karambwan in that they can be eaten without delay.

The enhanced crystal weapon seed has replaced the inactive Blade of Saeldor in the reward chest drop table, and the blade, as well as the Bow of Faerdhinen, can be created from the enhanced weapon seed.

poll: Old School Content Poll 71: Gauntlet, Grotesques, CoX and more
change:
*Messages that appear when receiving crystals in The Gauntlet are now filterable; this does affect the untradeable drop notification for crystal shards from monster drops.
*The max hits of all variants of the crystal and corrupted staves have been increased by 5.
*Filling vials and cooking paddlefish now occur in one tick (0.6 seconds).
*The inner square of rooms are now less randomised, and will always contain the same basic resources required to move on to the rest of The Gauntlet. This does not apply to the Corrupted Gauntlet.
*Players who have toggled the ability to automatically smash vials can now do so as soon as they've drunk the last dose of an egniol potion.
*Demi-bosses will now spawn in 6 of the 12 specific rooms of the Gauntlet's outer areas. The rooms in the outer area which they can spawn are the rooms non-adjacent to the corner rooms.
*The number of total resources required to create tier 2 and 3 armour have been reduced; the number of crystal shards required remain the same.
*The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef now play an animation right before changing attack styles to notify players to quickly change their protection prayers.
The Corrupted Gauntlet no longer gives extra Gauntlet capes to players who have one stored in a cape rack.
The Game Filter now filters the message displayed in the chatbox when players sing items at the Gauntlet's singing bowl.

*When creating items within the Gauntlet, the interface will remain open provided you have the ingredients to create other items.
*Killing a duplicate tier 3 creature within the Gauntlet will now have a guaranteed chance to drop a different powerful weapon component, provided you don't already have one. This was previously a 50% chance.
*The scoreboard in the Gauntlet lobby has been extended to display your deaths and the global deaths for each version of the Gauntlet.

update: SOTE Changes and Small Game Updates
change:
*The Crystalline and Corrupted Hunllef has been altered slightly: Ranged will always be the first attack style, damage has been increased when praying incorrectly (or not at all), and damage has been reduced when praying correctly.
*Players can no longer remove old school bonds from their bond pouch while in the Gauntlet.

The statue in The Giant Dwarf no longer has huge vertical gaps between its component parts.

update: Puro-Puro Improvements and Barbarian Assault Changes
change: Players will no longer be damaged by the Sleepwalkers special attack after teleporting out of an encounter with The Nightmare.

update: The Nightmare and Chambers of Xeric QoL
poll: Old School Content Poll 73: The :Joy: of Polls
change:
*The Nightmare's initial start timer has been reduced from 40 to 30 seconds. Players can disturb her again upon her defeat to start the next fight in 10 seconds.
*The scaling for her shield and totems has been changed. For groups of five or more, 200 and 30 health will be added to her shield and the totems per player, decreased from 400 and 60, respectively.
*Damage from parasites and husks are now completely negated if the correct protection prayers have been used.
*The pet drop rate has been changed to scale with group size. Previously, it was always 1/4,000 (or 1/3,800 for the MVP).
*An audio bug has been fixed in which the sound effect for The Nightmare's Confusion Curse ended too quietly.
*An issue was fixed where The Nightmare would sometimes appear to face away from the player who took damage because she was re-targeting the player with the highest Defence halfway through her attack.
Pets can no longer be brought to the Nightmare fight.
Crowded fights will no longer cause The Nightmare's broadcast messages to be truncated.
Players can now permanently dismiss the warning message that appears when leaving The Nightmare's dream world.
The standard loot quantities were increased. Unique and tertiary drops were made more common with their drop mechanics changed.

*Players will now be given fake XP drops when charging the totems in The Nightmare fight.
*Ironman Mode players now may fight alongside ordinary accounts instead of only being able to group with other iron players, and subsequently the Pool of Nightmares was removed.

update: Nightmare Feedback and the Zalcano Loot Table
change:

*A scoreboard has been added near Shura, which shows personal and global kills, deaths and fastest kill time.
*Players can now spectate players fighting by right-clicking the entry portal.
*To improve readability, messages that appear during the boss fight now have different colours.
*The volume of The Nightmare defend sound has been reduced again.
*The Nightmare has been added to the Boss Kill Count section of the HiScores page.

update: Nightmare of Ashihama - Day One Changes
change:

*The volume of The Nightmare defend sound has been reduced.

*There is now a greater chance to receive food and potions as a drop, and their quantity has been increased.
*The nightmare staff now has a separate roll from the other uniques.

update: Theatre of Blood: Entry Mode Improvements
change:
* Entry Mode changes:
** Changed how enemy Hitpoint scaling works depending on the number of players to be more consistent.
** Entry Mode runs now have unlimited attempts, and there is no longer a cost to reclaim items after failing or logging out.
** Bandages will now be given in the event of a wipe.
** The amount of normal rewards received has been increased from 15% to 20%.
* A selection prompt will now appear the first time a player interacts with the recruitment board.
Sotetseg's fade-to-white effect when teleporting players is now a little less glaring.
The party leader can now re-order their party at the notice board in Ver Sinhaza.

poll: A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
change: There's now less variation in where the Maiden Blood Spawns appear. Additionally, if players successfully dodge the blood, a maximum of only one Blood Spawn will appear.

poll: A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
change:
* A filter has been added to the Theatre of Blood Party Board to help players find their friends and Clanmates.
* Players can now use escape crystals on their party members to activate them, allowing teleportation of teammates out of the raid in an instant. To enable this, right-click a crystal and select 'Toggle'. Both players must have a crystal for this to work, and both crystals will be consumed in the process.

update: A Night At The Theatre Rework
change: The Story Mode version of the Theatre of Blood has been renamed to Entry Mode.

poll: A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
change: Story and hard modes added. Story mode provides an easier fight but less rewards and no chance of obtaining any unique, while hard mode provides a harder fight, but with a better chance of obtaining uniques and better common drops if completed in a specific time.

update: Arceuus Spellbook Beta and A Kingdom Divided Preparation
change: The Theatre of Blood is now a safe zone on PvP worlds.

poll: Old School Content Poll 74: Collection Log & Game Improvements
update: Collection Log Improvements and The Last of Poll 74
change: There's now a chest just opposite the bank booths, that allows one to obtain any loot they forgot to claim after defeating Verzik Vitur.
The quota of daily party formations in the Theatre of Blood has increased.
The death animation of Nylocas Athanatos and Matomenos has been reduced.
If players are attempting to start a Theatre of Blood wave, but some of their party members are still in the previous wave's arena, the warning screen that appears will now make this more explicit.

update: Automated Plank Make and In Game Clock
change:
*The Pestilent bloat within the Theatre of Blood should now fall down in the correct position.
*One of the Nylocas walking toward the centre of the arena will no longer incorrectly change into a smaller Nylocas.
*Verzik should now correctly move at the correct times during attack animations, to prevent her from appearing in the wrong location.
*Xarpus' exhumed phase has been made shorter and scaled better for smaller team sizes. To keep it balanced, each absorption is now more powerful.
*Odd pathing in Verzik's third phase caused by occasionally appearing to target a dead player has been fixed.

update: Making Friends With My Arm, Deadman Autumn Finals and Full Mobile Launch
change: Elite clue drop rate was changed, as it was previously 1/750.

update: Theatre of Blood Changes & Deadman Summer Finals
change:
*Bosses' Hitpoints now scale to four and three player teams.
*Resource chests now use a point system instead of giving random supplies.
*The Nylocas encounter was shortened by removing some earlier waves as they made the encounter needlessly long. The boss of the encounter was also buffed by making damage dealt with the incorrect style reflect and heal 100% instead of 50%, as well as increasing its Hitpoints and damage dealt.
*Other minor tweaks were made regarding balance and QoL.
